command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Download blob by name. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageBlobContent -Container containername -Blob blob -Destination C:\test\

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Download blob content using pipeline from GetAzureStorageBlob. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container containername -Blob blobname | Get-AzureStorageBlobContent

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Download blob content using pipeline from GetAzureStorageContainer. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageContainer container* | Get-AzureStorageBlobContent -Blob cbox.exe -Destination C:\test

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Generate a blob sas token with full blob permission. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureStorageBlobSASToken -Container cname -Blob bname -Permission rwd

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Generate a blob sas token with life time. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $startTime = Get-Date $endTime = $startTime.AddHours(2.0) New-AzureStorageBlobSASToken -Container cname -Blob bname -Permission rwd -StartTime $startTime -ExpiryTime $endTime

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Use NewAzureSotrageContext cmdlet with other storage cmdlet. --------------------------
-------------------------- Use multiple storage context. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $context1 = New-AzureStorageContext -Local $context2 = new-azurestoragecontext -StorageAccountName accountname -StorageAccountKey accountkey
($context1, $context2) | Get-AzureStorageContainer

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Create azure storage context with specified storage end point --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureStorageContext -StorageAccountName name -StorageAccountKey key -Endpoint core.windows.net

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Create azure storage context with specified storage end point --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureStorageContext -StorageAccountName name -StorageAccountKey key -Endpoint core.chinacloudapi.cn

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Create azure storage context with specified azure environment --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureStorageContext -StorageAccountName name -StorageAccountKey key -Environment AzureChinaCloud

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Create storage context with sas token and use it with other storage cmdlet. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sasToken = New-AzureStorageContainerSASToken -Container abc -Permission rl $context = New-AzureStorageContext -StorageAccountName account -SasToken $sasToken $context | Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container abc

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create an sas token with container read and list permission and then list all the blobs in the specified container.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageContainer -Container container* | Set-AzureStorageBlobContent -File filename -Blob blobname

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureStorageFileContent –ShareName sample –Source samplefile –FilePath sampledir/samplefile

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uploads the samplefile file to the path sampledir/samplefile in the sample file share.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy operation by name. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Start-CopyAzureStorageContainer -SrcContainer container1 -SrcBlob blob1 -DestContainer container2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy operation using container pipeline from GetAzureStorageContainer. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageContainer -Container container1 | Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -SrcBlob blob -DestContainer container2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- StartCopy to specified blob using pipeline from GetAzureStorageBlob --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container container1 | Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -DestContainer container2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- start copy operation to ICloudBlob object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $srcBlob = Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container container1 -Blob srcBlob $destBlob = Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container container2 -Blob destBlob
Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -ICloudBlob $srcBlob.ICloudBlob -DestICloudBlob $destBlob.ICloudBlob

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy operation using source uri --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $context = New-AzureStorageContainer -StorageAccountName accountname -StorageAccountKey accountkey
Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -SrcUri http://www.somesite.com/somefile -DestContainer container -DestBlob blob -DestContext $context
